metadata.title: CVE-2022-46883 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers Gabriele Svelto, Yulia Startsev, Andrew McCreight andthe Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox106. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presumethat with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to runarbitrary code.
*Note*: This advisory was added on December 13th, 2022after discovering it was inadvertently left out of the original advisory.The fix was included in the original release of Firefox 107. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 107. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
